Rules

General
1. Communication to the mod is to be done through bolded text in thread or PM.
2. I am not infallible, but I have the final say. Feel free to correct me wherever I make a mistake.
3. Do not use encryption, ciphers or otherwise unreadable text.
4. Play to your win condition under all circumstances. Play for your own enjoyment and the enjoyment of everybody else ingame under all circumstances.
5. Modkilling is an absolute last resort. I may force replace players if it is necessary. I would rather not have to do either.

Vote formatting
1. You may vote for any player by using the vote tag (e.g. VOTE: Human Sequencer). No lynch is also a valid target (e.g VOTE: No Lynch).
2. A lynch is reached when a majority of votes is reached. A majority is counted as one half of the playerlist rounded down, plus 1.
3. If a majority is not reached by the deadline, No Lynch will occur.
4. Bolded votes, unclear votes or votes in spoilers/quotes will not be counted.

Game Flow
1. The thread will be locked until at least 10 players confirm by PM, at which point I will unlock the thread and Day 1 will begin.
2. Players will be prodded after approximately 48 hours of inactivity. After three prods or at my own judgement/player request, I will replace inactive players.
3. D1 and D2 will last 14 days. D3 and 4 will last 10 days. After that, days will last 8 days.
4. Nights will always last 48 hours regardless of replacements or night actions.
5. Extensions may be granted on my own judgement in dire circumstances.
6. Flips will quote the role PM a player received, with names redacted.
7. The game will end when any faction's win-condition is met.
8. Mafia players have day talk.

Flavour/Miscellaneous
1. Inspectorscout, my backup moderator, may jump in to do a votecount or post a flip at any time. Do not be alarmed.
2. If no players have flipped after two ingame day/night cycles have passed, the game will end in a draw.
3. This game has flavour! All flavour will be clearly marked as such. It has no influence on the game whatsoever, even if it may draw inspiration from it. There is no hints to be found in flavour, so don't try.
4. Vanilla Townie Role PM:
Spoiler:
Welcome to Mini Normal XXXX. Your role is Vanilla Townie.
You have no special powers beyond voting.
You win when all threats to the town are eliminated.
Good luck!

Flavour starts here.


Your platoon has seen some action, that's sure. Cut down from thirty men, you now stand thirteen tall, and every face is burned into your mind. The war has dragged on you all, and you're just kinda sick of it all at this point.

That's why you were so happy when you finally got the memo-- Orders from the higher ups to retreat.
"Our war is over, lads" said your CO, and a wave of relief washed through all the weary soldiers that heard it.
Well, most. Some of you didn't like that, apparently.
What actually happened isn't sure, but what we do know is that your CO was found dead the next day, with a bullet shot clean through his helmet. A bullet fired from one of your rifles...

They say war is the only place where psychopaths can truly feel at home... Perhaps some of you wanted the war to keep going.
Retreat isn't an option without organized leadership-- You're cut off by the enemy from all angles, and your CO's communication equipment was smashed overnight. What a pickle you've found yourself in-- Or perhaps this is exactly what you wanted.

Flavour ends here.


Role PMs are being sent out.

10 players have confirmed.
It is now Day 1.

Day 1 deadline is in (expired on 2017-03-21 00:00:00)

That was quick.

Flavour starts here.


The platoon quickly falls into disarray. Arguments grew, grudges formed, and hatred dominated. All the while, three witty lunatics sat at the back, smiling. Everything was going according to plan.

Finally, in a moment of silence, Trumpeter ThinkBig said with exasperation 'Okay, how about we take out Lycanfire. I wouldn't trust him sleeping in my tent for one second.' Everybody slowly looked at ThinkBig, and then slowly started nodding their heads. Closing in on Lieutenant Lycanfire was easy, and the fear in his eyes was obvious. Master Sergeant MagnaofIllusion took one arm, and Vice Admiral ZZZX took the other. Mechanic momo cautiously looked up to ThinkBig, before ThinkBig handed him the only functioning pistol they had left, and nodded. Aiming it at Lycanfire's terrified face, the hammer dropped.

Pilfering Lycanfire's corpse found nothing suspicious, and nothing out of the ordinary. All they could find was an old styled quill, and an unfinished diary written home. After realizing the weight of their misdeeds, only too late realizing he wasn't lying in his death throes, everybody decided to go to sleep and mull it over another night.

Flavour ends here.

Everybody crawls out of their foxholes on the abandoned trenches late, and everybody quickly realizes why. Boonskiies is the first one to rush to Trumpeter ThinkBig's foxhole turned grave, where everybody finds ThinkBig two bullets clean through his heart and leg. Everybody is surprised, but not quite so shocked after experiencing the war.

The crew sits around the corpse, silently eating their leftover breakfast rations. ThinkBig's and Lycanfire's remain unopened out of respect, but that might tip as the days go on. This environment doesn't leave much space for common courtesy.

Finally deciding to properly analyze ThinkBig's remains, they find a comb for keeping his beard in check, and a functioning walkie talkie. Pressing the start communication button causes an echo noise somewhere, but the walkie talkie dies before the squad can more accurately pinpoint where this is coming from. Lamenting the death of a supposed innocent, the crew regrettably goes on with their day knowing that ThinkBig was probably in contact with somebody.

Throughout the day, the walkie talkie eerily echoes "tttthhhanks ooobaaama....' in a ghostlike tone, and nobody is quite sure what to make of it.

Flavour ends here.

Flavour starts here.


Mechanic momo was never much of a talker, and much more of a tinkerer. When it comes to squad conversation and banter, he's never been one to really get along. Perhaps this is signs of his lack of empathy, of perhaps it just made him an easy target. Nonetheless, he was the one chosen to die this afternoon.

Some of the squad has gone a bit loopy, you see. Being out here all alone, distraught with paranoia, it can really drag you down. The results are still very interesting. Results like a group of crazed infantrymen holding down momo, whilst incessantly baaing, as if sheep themselves. It would be quite a scene, if anybody sane were around to watch it. Unfortunately for most, and fortunately for few, nobody is. The last man to commit to momo's death is General -Grey-, exposing his inner sheep whilst shooting momo through the skull. The last words uttered by our unfortunate friend being 'Any questions???'

Everybody took a second to calm down before realizing they may have made a grave mistake. Initial inspection proved promising, as they pulled a tommy gun off of the corpse. Closer inspection, however, revealed it was a replica. Also found was a strange device attached to his arm-- Some sort of 'Pipe Buoy 3000'. The crew collectively decided to throw it in the trash, and sleep together tonight.

Flavour ends here.

Night two will end in (expired on 2017-04-05 00:00:00).

Flavour starts here.

The platoon awakens hoping against hope that everything will be all right, unaware that everything surely isn't. Despite sleeping in the same foxhole last night, everybody quickly realizes that Titus is missing. A frantic runaround ensues, and panic spreads, some real, and some acted.

Somebody uncovers a note left, written hurriedly in shorthand. 'Must go. Business to attend to. Went south. -Titus'. Of course, the rational decision here would be to walk south... Where Titus' corpse is found in an unsavory state. To protect the innocent, and to protect the children, this retelling will be light on details, but it would be adequate to say that this soldier was 'caught with their pants down'. Somebody couldn't hold it in overnight, and it cost them their life. What a cruel fate war is...

A quick pilfer of the body procured a small photograph of what seems to be the human representation of Pi in a way none of the platoon can quite comprehend, and another walkie talkie. Putting two and two together, it's safe to surmise that they were in cahoots with ThinkBig all along.

Flavour ends here.
